title: Lothar Kurbjuweit
text:
Lothar Kurbjuweit (born 6 November 1950 in <a href="Riesa">Riesa</a>) is a former <a href="Germans">German</a> <a href="Association%20football">football</a>er and <a href="Manager%20%28association%20football%29">football manager</a>.
Career.
Kurbjuweit played for <a href="Stahl%20Riesa">Stahl Riesa</a> (1965–1970) and <a href="FC%20Carl%20Zeiss%20Jena">FC Carl Zeiss Jena</a> (1970–1983).
International career.
On the national level he played for <a href="East%20Germany%20national%20football%20team">East Germany national team</a> (66 matches/four goals), and was a participant at the <a href="1974%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">1974 FIFA World Cup</a>.
Coaching career.
He later began coaching and led several teams, including <a href="FC%20Carl%20Zeiss%20Jena">FC Carl Zeiss Jena</a>, <a href="Rot-Weiss%20Erfurt">Rot-Weiss Erfurt</a> and <a href="VfB%20P%C3%B6%C3%9Fneck">VfB Pößneck</a>. Kurbjuweit was from 1996 between 1999 the club Chairman of <a href="FC%20Carl%20Zeiss%20Jena">FC Carl Zeiss Jena</a>. On 22 April 2010 he signed a contract as Director of Sport with his former club <a href="FC%20Carl%20Zeiss%20Jena">FC Carl Zeiss Jena</a>.
Personal life.
Kurbjuweit is married with the former long jumper Birgit Grimm and has a son with her <a href="Tobias%20Kurbjuweit">Tobias</a> who is a professional footballer. In the year 1992 he was named new business executive of Honda Präsent in Jena-Göschwitz and worked for the Carcenter between 2006.
